result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle M. Roach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DNA surcharge if needed in the future.
Court Costs remitted.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle M. Roach

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Kimberly
Case Called: 1:39pm
State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer.  Deft appears in person with Atty Gary Getzin

Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW.

PLEA: 
Ct. 1 Disorderly Conduct >> NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 


COURT ORDERS: 5 days MCJ, 4 days credit given. Court costs remitted. DNA surcharge if needed in future

Adj: 1:50pm
Defendant went to Public Defender's office and does qualify.  Future dates already set.

Pre-trial conference on June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No contact with victim(s): Paradox premises (Wausau).  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.    Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.    Shall not consume alcohol.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents
